content:
We've got a ballot reconciliation window open right now for SMARTv2 and for Bulk Data -- one question is whether we should take this opportunity to move the "Backend Services Authorization" page from Bulk Data --> SMARTv2.

This would help by:

  • Consolidating authorization profiles in one place (SMARTv2)
  • Clarifying that backend services authorization is useful beyond Bulk Data

Anybody think this is a bad idea?
@Lloyd McKenzie is this a "transfer" of a page that we can do during reconciliation of these two STU specs?

From an HL7 perspective, it's not really a transfer, it's adding rules to one spec and removing rules from another spec. Formally, there'd be no transfer of 'ballot experience' from the original page to the new page, but from an FMG you could finesse that if it ever became an issue
Thanks @Lloyd McKenzie! I guess I want to figure out is... should I try this? I think it'd be the right thing outcome-wise, but if there are deep procedural concerns I'd just skip it.
FWIW, +1 to moving it. It feels odd to link to the Bulk Data IG in order to talk about SMART Backend Auth, and it's harder to discover.
Is the spec the content being removed from normative? If it were, you might have to deprecate it rather than remove it. Other than that, I can't think of any procedural issues.
I think this is a great idea, does it mess up the intent of published regulation?
And clearly nothing about moving this page would change impact intent; ok less sure if it could create other procedural issues
I expect the change in bulk data would be to point to where the content went...
Yes, that's the thought -- replace the content with a reference
